introduction.question: How are you feeling today?
options: I'm not sure how I feel

introduction.question: Which kind of emotion do you experience as of lately: positive or negative emotions?
Are you satisfied with your school life?
Are you satisfied with your private life?
options: Not satisfied, I have a lot of problems.

branch_1.question: What kind of activities make you happy?
How do you celebrate your achievements?
What are your favorite ways to relax?
options: Listening to music, watching a movie/series

branch_1.question: How do you stay motivated at challenging times?
options: I think of my past victories

branch_1.question: What are you most proud of in your academic life?
options: My performance on a particular course

branch_1.question: How do you maintain a positive outlook on life?
options: I avoid negative people and thoughts
I focus on the good stuff
I try to pursue reasonable goals

branch_1.question: How do you handle stress in a healthy way?
What are your goals for the future?
What makes you feel appreciated?
options: Quality time with my loved ones

branch_1.question: How do you contribute to your community or help others?
options: I help my friends and closed ones

branch_1.question: What are you looking forward to in the near future?

branch_2.question: What has felt most challenging for you recently, and how have you been dealing with it?
When you're feeling low, what helps you feel even a little bit better?
What helps you stay grounded when school feels overwhelming?
How supported do you feel by the people around you?
What are some signs that you're feeling overwhelmed?
What has helped you cope with sadness or stress in the past?
What small change would make your current situation feel a little easier?
How do you feel about your academic progress right now?
What sometimes gets in the way of reaching your goals?
When things don't go as planned, how do you usually respond?
What situations tend to make you feel anxious?
How open do you feel to asking for help with your mental health?
What's one small thing you could do this week to take care of your mental health?
